Question
========
Which of the following statements are correct?  
  
I. In a mixed-design ANOVA there is always one dependent variable  
II. In a mixed-design ANOVA there is always more than one variable that
defines between group differences

Answerlist
----------
* Statement I is correct and statement II is incorrect.
* Statement I is incorrect and statement II is correct.
* Both statements are incorrect.
* Both statements are correct.

Solution
========





There is always only one dependent variable in a mixed design ANOVA. So,
statement I is correct.  
However, there can be one or more between variables. So, statement II is
incorrect.
